Product Description: ['The countdown has begun! Against the real-life backdrop of the U.S. deployment of WMDs in Europe during the escalating Cold War, this "dramatically involving [and] agonizingly graphic film" (The Hollywood Reporter) about nuclear holocaust detonated a direct hit into the heartland of America.Starring Jason Robards, JoBeth Williams, Steven Guttenberg, John Cullum and John Lithgow, this "controversial, potent drama" (Leonard Maltin) remains "one of the most talked-about programs in history"(Newsweek)! When Cold War tensions reach the ultimate boiling point, the inhabitants of a small town in Kansas learn along with the rest of America that they have fewer than 30 minutes before 300 Soviet warheads begin to appear overhead! Can anyone survive this ultimate nightmare...or the nuclear winter that is sure to follow?']
Average Rating: 4.7

Review Text: Might not be a great movie but truly an excellent public service message about the horrors of nuclear war. I was on active duty in the Navy in the midst of the Cold War, which always seemed to leave us on the knife’s edge between peace and war. Everyone should see this, especially the politicians, most of whom seem totally ignorant of the effects of playing chicken with nuclear weapons. This will scare the beejeezus out of you. As well it should.
Review Title: By the time the missiles fly, it is too late....
Rating: 5.0
